page.title: 19BARROW CIVIC SOCIETY
page.content: Many Civic Societes are concerned only with buildings but the Barrow Society is interested in both the natural and man made environment. Its aims include fostering an interest in the village's past so that the buildings of previous generations are appreciated, preserved and where necessary, restored; ensuring that careless modern development does not take place and disseminating information about Barrow's past, which extends at least as far back as Roman times. The Society is concerned also with the natural environment and wishes to encourage people to make the most of the country and riverside. It believes in the importance of trees and hedge rows in achieving a balanced landscape and would like to see further tree planting in this rather treeless area of England.
